content:
• Friday, June 24, 2011
  • DANG

    E-Commerce China DangDang (NYSE:DANG) shares -7.2% on continued concerns over China reverse...

    E-Commerce China DangDang (NYSE:DANG) shares -7.2% on continued concerns over China reverse merger corporate governance. Some say the indiscriminate selloff is overblown.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • NBGGY

    National Bank Greece (NBG) was among Friday's top losers on ongoing concerns over Greek...

    National Bank Greece (NBG) was among Friday's top losers on ongoing concerns over Greek political tensions. Shares fell 7.8% to $1.31, and are -32% over the last three months.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • IBM

    Shares of Kenexa (KNXA) finish -8.2% after a day-long selloff on no news.

    Shares of Kenexa (KNXA) finish -8.2% after a day-long selloff on no news.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • SFSF

    Shares of employee performance software developer SuccessFactors (NYSE:SFSF) rebound from early...

    Shares of employee performance software developer SuccessFactors (NYSE:SFSF) rebound from early morning lows, but still finish the day -8.7% on rumored of layoffs. A number of sell-side firms defended the stock, noting momentum in billings growth, and that competitors are reporting strong demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • CACB

    Cascade Bancorp (NASDAQ:CACB) fell 11.8% to $7.57 on more than 10x volume, but no news.

    Cascade Bancorp (NASDAQ:CACB) fell 11.8% to $7.57 on more than 10x volume, but no news.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK) winds up -8.8% after poor earnings from Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) and Micron Technology...

    SanDisk (SNDK) winds up -8.8% after poor earnings from Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) and Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU) sent investors scampering from tech stocks, resulting in a 1.26% slide in the Nasdaq and a 2.02% drop in the QQQs.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • QIHU

    Volatile QIHOO 360 Technology Co. (NYSE:QIHU) -9.8% on the day to $16.24 as China stocks...

    Volatile QIHOO 360 Technology Co. (NYSE:QIHU) -9.8% on the day to $16.24 as China stocks continue to underperform. Shares are now -52.2% since its red-hot IPO in late March.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • FENG

    Shares of Phoenix New Media (NYSE:FENG) finish the day -10.3% to $8.00. Possibly a reaction to...

    Shares of Phoenix New Media (NYSE:FENG) finish the day -10.3% to $8.00. Possibly a reaction to Wednesday afternoon's earnings announcement, though ADRs are down almost 46% since launching in mid-May.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • HMPR

    Hampton Roads Bankshares (NASDAQ:HMPR) sold off in the final minutes of trading to finish the...

    Hampton Roads Bankshares (NASDAQ:HMPR) sold off in the final minutes of trading to finish the day -10.4%. Shares took a hit on Thursday after HMPR announced plans to sell its Charlottesville branch.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • ATRS

    Shares of Antares Pharma (AIS) spiked in late trading to finish +10.1% at $2.17. No news of note.

    Shares of Antares Pharma (AIS) spiked in late trading to finish +10.1% at $2.17. No news of note.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • EPRS

    Investors drove shares of Zalicus (ZLCS) up 11% after Novartis (NYSE:NVS) filed its first...

    Investors drove shares of Zalicus (ZLCS) up 11% after Novartis (NYSE:NVS) filed its first Zalcius cHTS patent application for multiple myeloma. More good news for ZLCS investors here.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • CNU

    Steady gains for Continucare (NYSE:CNU) were accentuated by a late afternoon surge on strong...

    Steady gains for Continucare (NYSE:CNU) were accentuated by a late afternoon surge on strong volume. Shares closed +11.7% to $4.77.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • VIAS

    A late-hour surge lifts shares of Viasystems Group (NASDAQ:VIAS) to $22.23, a 12% gain.

    A late-hour surge lifts shares of Viasystems Group (NASDAQ:VIAS) to $22.23, a 12% gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • ICOG

    ICO Global Communications (NASDAQ:ICOG) jumps in the final minutes to finish the day +12.9%. No...

    ICO Global Communications (NASDAQ:ICOG) jumps in the final minutes to finish the day +12.9%. No news reported.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • LXRX

    Shares of Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) surge in the last half-hour of trading on...

    Shares of Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) surge in the last half-hour of trading on unusual volume to finish the day +11.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • MSFG

    MainSource Financial Group (NASDAQ:MSFG) rose steadily throughout the session, finishing +14.2%....

    MainSource Financial Group (NASDAQ:MSFG) rose steadily throughout the session, finishing +14.2%. The move was apparently unrelated to the addition of industry veteran Charles Thayer to its board, which was announced after the close.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • NYMX

    Shares of Nymox Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:NYMX) surge higher on unusual volume in the final minutes...

    Shares of Nymox Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:NYMX) surge higher on unusual volume in the final minutes to finish +17.9% on no apparent news.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle's (ORCL -4.2%) Mark Hurd claims switching to a higher-margin sales strategy in its...

    Oracle's (ORCL -4.2%) Mark Hurd claims switching to a higher-margin sales strategy in its hardware business is what hurt the bottom-line this quarter. Analysts disagree, blaming it on shaky management, slower shipments, and an inability to integrate last year's acquisition of Sun Micro.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • ORCL

    Techs (XLK -1.7%) are pulled broadly lower by last night's earnings announcements (I, II) from...

    Techs (XLK -1.7%) are pulled broadly lower by last night's earnings announcements (I, II) from Oracle (ORCL -4.1%) and Micron (MU -13.3%), but analysts generally seem to remain optimistic on both. Underperformance in Oracle's hardware is not a big concern as long as software licenses stay strong, and Micron's DRAM weakness is just a hiccup.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • BRCD

    Brocade (BRCD -5.5%) dips after waiting three days to announce its CFO Richard Deranleau...

    Brocade (BRCD -5.5%) dips after waiting three days to announce its CFO Richard Deranleau resigned effective last Monday to pursue other interests. He will be succeeded internally by executive Dan Fairfax.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • UAL

    United Continental (UAL -7.8%) shares plummet after the airline tells investors it expects...

    United Continental (UAL -7.8%) shares plummet after the airline tells investors it expects passenger revenue per available seat mile to rise 8.3-9.3% this quarter, well below forecasts. American Airlines (AMR -6.2%) also issues a negative outlook, citing U.S. weather disruptions and effects from the Japan quake. Also: DAL -5.1%, LCC -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • FMD

    Heavily shorted savings and loan First Marblehead (FMD +9.8%) has a rally under way that may...

    Heavily shorted savings and loan First Marblehead (FMD +9.8%) has a rally under way that may show a change in sentiment as the lender tries a turnaround. FMD suspended its dividend in 2007, and though losses continue, they may be slowing down.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • AUMN

    Golden Minerals (AUMN +0.5%) will pay about $309M in cash and stock to buy ECU Silver Mining...

    Golden Minerals (AUMN +0.5%) will pay about $309M in cash and stock to buy ECU Silver Mining (ECUXF.PK -7.7%) in a reverse merger that values ECU at about a 7% discount to Thursday's close. Each company's got Latin American assets and the merged entity will focus on silver mining in Mexico and Argentina.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 1 Comment

  • Trading's at seven times normal volume in business-cloud company SuccessFactors (SFSF -11.8% to...

    Trading's at seven times normal volume in business-cloud company SuccessFactors (SFSF -11.8% to $28.55), taking a beating though analysts are coming to its rescue and have an average price target of $41.37. Options volume is multiple times average, with some 2,000 July 32 puts bought from $1.90-$2.65.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • CAAS

    China Automotive Systems (NASDAQ:CAAS) files an amended 10-K/A that corrects a number of errors...

    China Automotive Systems (NASDAQ:CAAS) files an amended 10-K/A that corrects a number of errors from 2009, including an adjustment of $49.9B in net income attributable to the parent company. Shares up 12%, part of an updraft for Asian stocks in the U.S. on China's inflation bullishness.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • DRRX

    Durect (DRRX -28%) is another casualty of the FDA's rejection of Remoxy. Its technology -...

    Durect (DRRX -28%) is another casualty of the FDA's rejection of Remoxy. Its technology - designed to discourage common methods of tampering - was used to develop the drug. PTIE -37%, PFE -1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • SSN

    Samson Oil (SSN +6.85%) acquires 90K acres of oil and gas leases in Montana from Fort Peck...

    Samson Oil (SSN +6.85%) acquires 90K acres of oil and gas leases in Montana from Fort Peck Energy. The purchase will be made in 3 tranches, with the first 20K parcel set to operate immediately with two wells.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM

  • European shares are in rapid retreat as the week winds down. Sharply higher earlier today, the...

    European shares are in rapid retreat as the week winds down. Sharply higher earlier today, the Stoxx 50 has given up more than 2%, now -0.4%. Italian shares are leading the decline, -1.5%, on the Moody's bank warning and rumors of S&P piling on. The euro gives up its gains as well. EWI -3.1%, EWP -3.3%, FXE -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • BBBB

    Buyout firm Providence Equity Partners is in exclusive talks to buy educational software company...

    Buyout firm Providence Equity Partners is in exclusive talks to buy educational software company Blackboard (NASDAQ:BBBB), and a deal could be announced as early as next week, WSJ reports. Blackboard reportedly has sought more than 12x Ebitda, or ~$1.5B. BBBB +6.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • PTIE

    Pain Therapeutics (PTIE -51.3%) and Pfizer (PFE -0.4%) confirm they received a Complete Response...

    Pain Therapeutics (PTIE -51.3%) and Pfizer (PFE -0.4%) confirm they received a Complete Response Letter from the FDA on painkiller Remoxy, and say they're "working to evaluate the issues" described in the letter. Rival Acura (OTC:ACUR +19%) had a pain drug approved earlier this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
